txt.en: Instance: Hard Negotiations
'Stop your shouting!'
'I assure you, you have my attention. There is no need for such theatrics outside the hall of the King!'
'Edric? What business brings you here at such an hour?'
'Éowyn!'
'ÉOWYN!'
'I see... You two return to the hall, I know not how long this will be.'
'Now... what is it you wish to speak of?'
'Edric... I am so sorry to hear such tidings...'
'The war, our history, the Eastemnet... can you not see what might still be lost?'
'Where is everyone?'
'Edric, your grief has consumed you... I cannot help you, not like this.'
'Come, we must walk to Meduseld from here...'
'I mourn for your people, Edric. Truly, I do, but you cannot believe such things!'
'Do you know why I have brought you here?'
'It was no fault of the King! The White Hand are to blame, and you know this as well as I, Edric!'
'No?'
'[placeholder], you must bear witness to the terror that befell my people.'
'Only then can they understand what I must do...'
'I apologise for my outburst, but it is a serious matter, Éowyn.'
'May we speak in private?'
'My people were slain to the last, Éowyn.'
'My wife...fell with them, butchered alongside the rest.'
'I have come to report that the Wade is lost.'
'Though it stands yet, what reason remains to defend it?'
'Nor did you before... you left us to die!'
'Tell me my people were not forgotten! Dare you speak that!'
'The guilt lies with Théoden! I shall not forgive him simply for casting Wormtongue from his court.'
'Only through his inaction does their blood stain the fields of Rohan!'
'And you...'
'Yours shall be the blood that stains his hands!'
'Léoflad...'
'Let us hasten to Meduseld, I tire of climbing these stairs at such a pace.'
